Docs.param: The document to merge; Set only the fields that you want to change.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction<T> Merge<T> (T document) where T : class;
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction`1<!!T> Merge<class T>(!!T document) cil managed

Docs.typeparam: The CLR type that maps to the index schema. Instances of this type can be stored as documents in the index.
Docs.param: The document to merge; Set only the properties that you want to change.
Docs.summary: Creates a new IndexAction for merging a document into an existing document in the index.
Docs.remarks: If type T contains non-nullable value-typed properties, these properties may not merge correctly. If you do not set such a property, it will automatically take its default value (for example, 0 for int or false for bool), which will override the value of the property currently stored in the index, even if this was not your intent. For this reason, it is strongly recommended that you always declare value-typed properties to be nullable in type T.
